organization.fullName: Henan University of Traditional Chinese Medicine

identificationModule.briefTitle: Moxibustion Reduces Symptoms and Improves Quality of Life in Patients With Allergic Rhinitis
identificationModule.officialTitle: The Therapeutic Effect and Standardization of Moxibustion in the Treatment of Allergic Rhinitis

leadSponsor.name: Henan University of Traditional Chinese Medicine

descriptionModule.briefSummary:
The objective of this randomized controlled clinical trial is to compare the therapeutic effect of moxibustion on allergic rhinitis. The main questions it aims to answer are:

Based on randomized controlled trials, verify the effectiveness of moxibustion in treating allergic rhinitis Based on a real-time monitoring system for human surface temperature, discuss the differences in therapeutic effects of different moxibustion doses on allergic rhinitis
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: Allergic rhinitis has a high incidence and is difficult to cure, seriously affecting the quality of life of patients Compare the effects of different moxibustion durations on the clinical efficacy and body surface temperature of patients with allergic rhinitis, and preliminarily explore the impact of different moxibustion doses on the efficacy of heavy moxibustion treatment for allergic rhinitis, providing evidence-based basis for clinical practice.

armGroups.label: First group of heavy moxibustion
interventionNames: Behavioral: First group of heavy moxibustion

armGroups.label: Second groups of heavy moxibustion
interventionNames: Behavioral: Second groups of heavy moxibustion

primaryOutcomes.description: VAS will be used to evaluate the relief of rhinitis symptoms, with a total score of 0-10. The higher the score, the more severe the symptoms will be
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Change from baseline VAS scores at week 0(before treatment)，4 and 12.

primaryOutcomes.description: The main symptoms of allergic rhinitis, the higher the score, the worse the condition
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Change from baseline TNSS scores at week 0(before treatment)，4 and 12.

secondaryOutcomes.description: The nasal accompanying symptoms of allergic rhinitis, qualitative evaluation of the severity of the disease, with some indicating severity and none indicating milder severity
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Change from baseline TNNSS scores at week0(before treatment)，4 and 12.

secondaryOutcomes.description: RQLQ consists of 28 items, including daily life (1-3), sleep (4-6), non nasal eye symptoms (7-13), life problems (14-16), nasal symptoms (17-20), eye symptoms (21-24), and emotions (25-28). In the 7-point system, 1 point is the best and 7 points are the worst.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Change from baseline RQLQ scores at week0(before treatment)，4 and 12.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Detection of serum IgE and IL-33 levels
secondaryOutcomes.description: Immunoglobulin IgE and serum inflammatory cytokine IL-33 levels

overallOfficials.name: Yang Xie, MD
overallOfficials.affiliation: Henan University of Traditonal Chinese Medicine

locations.facility: The First Affiliated Hospital of Henan University of Chinese Medicine
